    • getClassData

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> getClassData​(java.util.List<java.io.File> filesList) throws java.lang.Exception
      This method gets a class and calculates their number of lines of code, lines of comments and other metrics.
      Parameters:
      filesList - list of files
      Returns:
      2D ArrayList containing the metrics of every class in the folder
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • getMethodsData

      This method gets methods and calculates their number of lines of code, lines of comments and other metrics
      Parameters:
      filesList - list of files
      Returns:
      2D ArrayList containing the metrics of every method in the folder
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • cleanMethodName

      public java.lang.String cleanMethodName​(java.lang.String line)
      This method gets the name and arrgument types of a method, joining them with underscores and ignoring access modifiers and return type. ex: public void methodName(typeOfArg1 arg1, typeOfArg2 arg2) becomes methodName_typeOfArg1_typeOfArg2
      Parameters:
      line - of code
      Returns:
      cleaned method

      This method analyzes if a line contains some predicate from the complexity of McCabe or not and gives it a state.
      Parameters:
      line - of code
      Returns:
      boolean

    • findMethods

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> findMethods​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> lines)

    • findMethodContent

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> findMethodContent​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> lines, java.lang.String method)
      This method goes through a list of code lines and finds the content of a specified method by taking everything from the first "{" and last "}" by incrementing and decrementing the number of brackets.
      Parameters:
      lines - of code
      method - that we want to find the content of
      Returns:
      ArrayList of methods as strings and their content
